00071 /* ************************************************** */
00072 /* KEYING SETS - OPERATORS (for use in UI panels) */
00073 /* These operators are really duplication of existing functionality, but just for completeness,
00074  * they're here too, and will give the basic data needed...
00075  */
00076 
00077 /* poll callback for adding default KeyingSet */
00078 static int keyingset_poll_default_add (bContext *C)
00079 {
00080     /* as long as there's an active Scene, it's fine */
00081     return (CTX_data_scene(C) != NULL);
00082 }
00083 
00084 /* poll callback for editing active KeyingSet */
00085 static int keyingset_poll_active_edit (bContext *C)
00086 {
00087     Scene *scene= CTX_data_scene(C);
00088     
00089     if (scene == NULL)
00090         return 0;
00091     
00092     /* there must be an active KeyingSet (and KeyingSets) */
00093     return ((scene->active_keyingset > 0) && (scene->keyingsets.first));
00094 }
00095 
00096 /* poll callback for editing active KeyingSet Path */
00097 static int keyingset_poll_activePath_edit (bContext *C)
00098 {
00099     Scene *scene= CTX_data_scene(C);
00100     KeyingSet *ks;
00101     
00102     if (scene == NULL)
00103         return 0;
00104     if (scene->active_keyingset <= 0)
00105         return 0;
00106     else
00107         ks= BLI_findlink(&scene->keyingsets, scene->active_keyingset-1);
00108     
00109     /* there must be an active KeyingSet and an active path */
00110     return ((ks) && (ks->paths.first) && (ks->active_path > 0));
00111 }
00112 
00113  
00114 /* Add a Default (Empty) Keying Set ------------------------- */
00115 
00116 static int add_default_keyingset_exec (bContext *C, wmOperator *UNUSED(op))
00117 {
00118     Scene *scene= CTX_data_scene(C);
00119     short flag=0, keyingflag=0;
00120     
00121     /* validate flags 
00122      *  - absolute KeyingSets should be created by default
00123      */
00124     flag |= KEYINGSET_ABSOLUTE;
00125     
00126     /* 2nd arg is 0 to indicate that we don't want to include autokeying mode related settings */
00127     keyingflag = ANIM_get_keyframing_flags(scene, 0);
00128     
00129     /* call the API func, and set the active keyingset index */
00130     BKE_keyingset_add(&scene->keyingsets, NULL, NULL, flag, keyingflag);
00131     
00132     scene->active_keyingset= BLI_countlist(&scene->keyingsets);
00133     
00134     /* send notifiers */
00135     WM_event_add_notifier(C, NC_SCENE|ND_KEYINGSET, NULL);
00136     
00137     return OPERATOR_FINISHED;
00138 }
00139 
00140 void ANIM_OT_keying_set_add (wmOperatorType *ot)
00141 {
00142     /* identifiers */
00143     ot->name = "Add Empty Keying Set";
00144     ot->idname = "ANIM_OT_keying_set_add";
00145     ot->description = "Add a new (empty) Keying Set to the active Scene";
00146     
00147     /* callbacks */
00148     ot->exec = add_default_keyingset_exec;
00149     ot->poll = keyingset_poll_default_add;
00150 }
00151 
00152 /* Remove 'Active' Keying Set ------------------------- */
00153 
00154 static int remove_active_keyingset_exec (bContext *C, wmOperator *op)
00155 {
00156     Scene *scene= CTX_data_scene(C);
00157     KeyingSet *ks;
00158     
00159     /* verify the Keying Set to use:
00160      *  - use the active one
00161      *  - return error if it doesn't exist
00162      */
00163     if (scene->active_keyingset == 0) {
00164         BKE_report(op->reports, RPT_ERROR, "No active Keying Set to remove");
00165         return OPERATOR_CANCELLED;
00166     }
00167     else if (scene->active_keyingset < 0) {
00168         BKE_report(op->reports, RPT_ERROR, "Cannot remove built in Keying Set");
00169         return OPERATOR_CANCELLED;
00170     }
00171     else
00172         ks= BLI_findlink(&scene->keyingsets, scene->active_keyingset-1);
00173     
00174     /* free KeyingSet's data, then remove it from the scene */
00175     BKE_keyingset_free(ks);
00176     BLI_freelinkN(&scene->keyingsets, ks);
00177     
00178     /* the active one should now be the previously second-to-last one */
00179     scene->active_keyingset--;
00180     
00181     /* send notifiers */
00182     WM_event_add_notifier(C, NC_SCENE|ND_KEYINGSET, NULL);
00183     
00184     return OPERATOR_FINISHED;
00185 }
00186 
00187 void ANIM_OT_keying_set_remove (wmOperatorType *ot)
00188 {
00189     /* identifiers */
00190     ot->name = "Remove Active Keying Set";
00191     ot->idname = "ANIM_OT_keying_set_remove";
00192     ot->description = "Remove the active Keying Set";
00193     
00194     /* callbacks */
00195     ot->exec = remove_active_keyingset_exec;
00196     ot->poll = keyingset_poll_active_edit;
00197 }
00198 
00199 /* Add Empty Keying Set Path ------------------------- */
00200 
00201 static int add_empty_ks_path_exec (bContext *C, wmOperator *op)
00202 {
00203     Scene *scene= CTX_data_scene(C);
00204     KeyingSet *ks;
00205     KS_Path *ksp;
00206     
00207     /* verify the Keying Set to use:
00208      *  - use the active one
00209      *  - return error if it doesn't exist
00210      */
00211     if (scene->active_keyingset == 0) {
00212         BKE_report(op->reports, RPT_ERROR, "No active Keying Set to add empty path to");
00213         return OPERATOR_CANCELLED;
00214     }
00215     else
00216         ks= BLI_findlink(&scene->keyingsets, scene->active_keyingset-1);
00217     
00218     /* don't use the API method for this, since that checks on values... */
00219     ksp= MEM_callocN(sizeof(KS_Path), "KeyingSetPath Empty");
00220     BLI_addtail(&ks->paths, ksp);
00221     ks->active_path= BLI_countlist(&ks->paths);
00222     
00223     ksp->groupmode= KSP_GROUP_KSNAME; // XXX?
00224     ksp->idtype= ID_OB;
00225     ksp->flag= KSP_FLAG_WHOLE_ARRAY;
00226     
00227     return OPERATOR_FINISHED;
00228 }
00229 
00230 void ANIM_OT_keying_set_path_add (wmOperatorType *ot)
00231 {
00232     /* identifiers */
00233     ot->name = "Add Empty Keying Set Path";
00234     ot->idname = "ANIM_OT_keying_set_path_add";
00235     ot->description = "Add empty path to active Keying Set";
00236     
00237     /* callbacks */
00238     ot->exec = add_empty_ks_path_exec;
00239     ot->poll = keyingset_poll_active_edit;
00240 }
00241 
00242 /* Remove Active Keying Set Path ------------------------- */
00243 
00244 static int remove_active_ks_path_exec (bContext *C, wmOperator *op)
00245 {
00246     Scene *scene= CTX_data_scene(C);
00247     KeyingSet *ks= BLI_findlink(&scene->keyingsets, scene->active_keyingset-1);
00248     
00249     /* if there is a KeyingSet, find the nominated path to remove */
00250     if (ks) {
00251         KS_Path *ksp= BLI_findlink(&ks->paths, ks->active_path-1);
00252         
00253         if (ksp) {
00254             /* remove the active path from the KeyingSet */
00255             BKE_keyingset_free_path(ks, ksp);
00256             
00257             /* the active path should now be the previously second-to-last active one */
00258             ks->active_path--;
00259         }
00260         else {
00261             BKE_report(op->reports, RPT_ERROR, "No active Keying Set Path to remove");
00262             return OPERATOR_CANCELLED;
00263         }
00264     }
00265     else {
00266         BKE_report(op->reports, RPT_ERROR, "No active Keying Set to remove a path from");
00267         return OPERATOR_CANCELLED;
00268     }
00269     
00270     return OPERATOR_FINISHED;
00271 }
00272 
00273 void ANIM_OT_keying_set_path_remove (wmOperatorType *ot)
00274 {
00275     /* identifiers */
00276     ot->name = "Remove Active Keying Set Path";
00277     ot->idname = "ANIM_OT_keying_set_path_remove";
00278     ot->description = "Remove active Path from active Keying Set";
00279     
00280     /* callbacks */
00281     ot->exec = remove_active_ks_path_exec;
00282     ot->poll = keyingset_poll_activePath_edit;
00283 }

00285 /* ************************************************** */
00286 /* KEYING SETS - OPERATORS (for use in UI menus) */
00287 
00288 /* Add to KeyingSet Button Operator ------------------------ */
00289 
00290 static int add_keyingset_button_exec (bContext *C, wmOperator *op)
00291 {
00292     Main *bmain= CTX_data_main(C);
00293     Scene *scene= CTX_data_scene(C);
00294     KeyingSet *ks = NULL;
00295     PropertyRNA *prop= NULL;
00296     PointerRNA ptr= {{NULL}};
00297     char *path = NULL;
00298     short success= 0;
00299     int index=0, pflag=0;
00300     int all= RNA_boolean_get(op->ptr, "all");
00301     
00302     /* verify the Keying Set to use:
00303      *  - use the active one for now (more control over this can be added later)
00304      *  - add a new one if it doesn't exist 
00305      */
00306     if (scene->active_keyingset == 0) {
00307         short flag=0, keyingflag=0;
00308         
00309         /* validate flags 
00310          *  - absolute KeyingSets should be created by default
00311          */
00312         flag |= KEYINGSET_ABSOLUTE;
00313         
00314         keyingflag |= ANIM_get_keyframing_flags(scene, 0);
00315         
00316         if (IS_AUTOKEY_FLAG(scene, XYZ2RGB)) 
00317             keyingflag |= INSERTKEY_XYZ2RGB;
00318             
00319         /* call the API func, and set the active keyingset index */
00320         ks= BKE_keyingset_add(&scene->keyingsets, "ButtonKeyingSet", "Button Keying Set", flag, keyingflag);
00321         
00322         scene->active_keyingset= BLI_countlist(&scene->keyingsets);
00323     }
00324     else if (scene->active_keyingset < 0) {
00325         BKE_report(op->reports, RPT_ERROR, "Cannot add property to built in Keying Set");
00326         return OPERATOR_CANCELLED;
00327     }
00328     else
00329         ks= BLI_findlink(&scene->keyingsets, scene->active_keyingset-1);
00330     
00331     /* try to add to keyingset using property retrieved from UI */
00332     uiContextActiveProperty(C, &ptr, &prop, &index);
00333     
00334     /* check if property is able to be added */
00335     if (ptr.id.data && ptr.data && prop && RNA_property_animateable(&ptr, prop)) {
00336         path= RNA_path_from_ID_to_property(&ptr, prop);
00337         
00338         if (path) {
00339             /* set flags */
00340             if (all) {
00341                 pflag |= KSP_FLAG_WHOLE_ARRAY;
00342                 
00343                 /* we need to set the index for this to 0, even though it may break in some cases, this is 
00344                  * necessary if we want the entire array for most cases to get included without the user
00345                  * having to worry about where they clicked
00346                  */
00347                 index= 0;
00348             }
00349                 
00350             /* add path to this setting */
00351             BKE_keyingset_add_path(ks, ptr.id.data, NULL, path, index, pflag, KSP_GROUP_KSNAME);
00352             ks->active_path= BLI_countlist(&ks->paths);
00353             success= 1;
00354             
00355             /* free the temp path created */
00356             MEM_freeN(path);
00357         }
00358     }
00359     
00360     if (success) {
00361         /* send updates */
00362         DAG_ids_flush_update(bmain, 0);
00363         
00364         /* for now, only send ND_KEYS for KeyingSets */
00365         WM_event_add_notifier(C, NC_SCENE|ND_KEYINGSET, NULL);
00366     }
00367     
00368     return (success)? OPERATOR_FINISHED: OPERATOR_CANCELLED;
00369 }
00370 
00371 void ANIM_OT_keyingset_button_add (wmOperatorType *ot)
00372 {
00373     /* identifiers */
00374     ot->name = "Add to Keying Set";
00375     ot->idname = "ANIM_OT_keyingset_button_add";
00376     
00377     /* callbacks */
00378     ot->exec = add_keyingset_button_exec; 
00379     //op->poll= ???
00380     
00381     /* flags */
00382     ot->flag = OPTYPE_REGISTER|OPTYPE_UNDO;
00383 
00384     /* properties */
00385     RNA_def_boolean(ot->srna, "all", 1, "All", "Add all elements of the array to a Keying Set");
00386 }
00387 
00388 /* Remove from KeyingSet Button Operator ------------------------ */
00389 
00390 static int remove_keyingset_button_exec (bContext *C, wmOperator *op)
00391 {
00392     Main *bmain= CTX_data_main(C);
00393     Scene *scene= CTX_data_scene(C);
00394     KeyingSet *ks = NULL;
00395     PropertyRNA *prop= NULL;
00396     PointerRNA ptr= {{NULL}};
00397     char *path = NULL;
00398     short success= 0;
00399     int index=0;
00400     
00401     /* verify the Keying Set to use:
00402      *  - use the active one for now (more control over this can be added later)
00403      *  - return error if it doesn't exist
00404      */
00405     if (scene->active_keyingset == 0) {
00406         BKE_report(op->reports, RPT_ERROR, "No active Keying Set to remove property from");
00407         return OPERATOR_CANCELLED;
00408     }
00409     else if (scene->active_keyingset < 0) {
00410         BKE_report(op->reports, RPT_ERROR, "Cannot remove property from built in Keying Set");
00411         return OPERATOR_CANCELLED;
00412     }
00413     else
00414         ks= BLI_findlink(&scene->keyingsets, scene->active_keyingset-1);
00415     
00416     /* try to add to keyingset using property retrieved from UI */
00417     uiContextActiveProperty(C, &ptr, &prop, &index);
00418 
00419     if (ptr.id.data && ptr.data && prop) {
00420         path= RNA_path_from_ID_to_property(&ptr, prop);
00421         
00422         if (path) {
00423             KS_Path *ksp;
00424             
00425             /* try to find a path matching this description */
00426             ksp= BKE_keyingset_find_path(ks, ptr.id.data, ks->name, path, index, KSP_GROUP_KSNAME);
00427 
00428             if (ksp) {
00429                 BKE_keyingset_free_path(ks, ksp);
00430                 success= 1;
00431             }
00432             
00433             /* free temp path used */
00434             MEM_freeN(path);
00435         }
00436     }
00437     
00438     
00439     if (success) {
00440         /* send updates */
00441         DAG_ids_flush_update(bmain, 0);
00442         
00443         /* for now, only send ND_KEYS for KeyingSets */
00444         WM_event_add_notifier(C, NC_SCENE|ND_KEYINGSET, NULL);
00445     }
00446     
00447     return (success)? OPERATOR_FINISHED: OPERATOR_CANCELLED;
00448 }

00454     ot->idname = "ANIM_OT_keyingset_button_remove";

00466 /* Change Active KeyingSet Operator ------------------------ */
00467 /* This operator checks if a menu should be shown for choosing the KeyingSet to make the active one */
00468 
00469 static int keyingset_active_menu_invoke (bContext *C, wmOperator *op, wmEvent *UNUSED(event))
00470 {
00471     uiPopupMenu *pup;
00472     uiLayout *layout;
00473     
00474     /* call the menu, which will call this operator again, hence the canceled */
00475     pup = uiPupMenuBegin(C, op->type->name, ICON_NONE);
00476     layout = uiPupMenuLayout(pup);
00477     uiItemsEnumO(layout, "ANIM_OT_keying_set_active_set", "type");
00478     uiPupMenuEnd(C, pup);
00479     
00480     return OPERATOR_CANCELLED;
00481 }
00482 
00483 static int keyingset_active_menu_exec (bContext *C, wmOperator *op)
00484 {
00485     Scene *scene = CTX_data_scene(C);
00486     int type = RNA_enum_get(op->ptr, "type");
00487     
00488     /* If type == 0, it will deselect any active keying set. */
00489     scene->active_keyingset = type;
00490     
00491     /* send notifiers */
00492     WM_event_add_notifier(C, NC_SCENE|ND_KEYINGSET, NULL);
00493     
00494     return OPERATOR_FINISHED;
00495 }

00497 void ANIM_OT_keying_set_active_set (wmOperatorType *ot)
00498 {
00499     PropertyRNA *prop;
00500     
00501     /* identifiers */
00502     ot->name = "Set Active Keying Set";
00503     ot->idname = "ANIM_OT_keying_set_active_set";
00504     
00505     /* callbacks */
00506     ot->invoke = keyingset_active_menu_invoke;
00507     ot->exec = keyingset_active_menu_exec; 
00508     ot->poll = ED_operator_areaactive;
00509     
00510     /* flags */
00511     ot->flag = OPTYPE_REGISTER|OPTYPE_UNDO;
00512     
00513     /* keyingset to use (dynamic enum) */
00514     prop= RNA_def_enum(ot->srna, "type", DummyRNA_DEFAULT_items, 0, "Keying Set", "The Keying Set to use");
00515     RNA_def_enum_funcs(prop, ANIM_keying_sets_enum_itemf);
00516 /*  RNA_def_property_flag(prop, PROP_HIDDEN);*/
00517 }
00518 
00519 /* ******************************************* */
00520 /* REGISTERED KEYING SETS */
00521 
00522 /* Keying Set Type Info declarations */
00523 static ListBase keyingset_type_infos = {NULL, NULL};
00524 
00525 /* Built-In Keying Sets (referencing type infos)*/
00526 ListBase builtin_keyingsets = {NULL, NULL};
00527 
00528 /* --------------- */
00529 
00530 /* Find KeyingSet type info given a name */
00531 KeyingSetInfo *ANIM_keyingset_info_find_named (const char name[])
00532 {
00533     /* sanity checks */
00534     if ((name == NULL) || (name[0] == 0))
00535         return NULL;
00536         
00537     /* search by comparing names */
00538     return BLI_findstring(&keyingset_type_infos, name, offsetof(KeyingSetInfo, idname));
00539 }
00540 
00541 /* Find builtin KeyingSet by name */
00542 KeyingSet *ANIM_builtin_keyingset_get_named (KeyingSet *prevKS, const char name[])
00543 {
00544     KeyingSet *ks, *first=NULL;
00545     
00546     /* sanity checks  any name to check? */
00547     if (name[0] == 0)
00548         return NULL;
00549     
00550     /* get first KeyingSet to use */
00551     if (prevKS && prevKS->next)
00552         first= prevKS->next;
00553     else
00554         first= builtin_keyingsets.first;
00555     
00556     /* loop over KeyingSets checking names */
00557     for (ks= first; ks; ks= ks->next) {
00558         if (strcmp(name, ks->idname) == 0)
00559             return ks;
00560     }
00561 
00562     /* complain about missing keying sets on debug builds */
00563 #ifndef NDEBUG
00564     printf("%s: '%s' not found\n", __func__, name);
00565 #endif
00566 
00567     /* no matches found */
00568     return NULL;
00569 }
00570 
00571 /* --------------- */
00572 
00573 /* Add the given KeyingSetInfo to the list of type infos, and create an appropriate builtin set too */
00574 void ANIM_keyingset_info_register (KeyingSetInfo *ksi)
00575 {
00576     KeyingSet *ks;
00577     
00578     /* create a new KeyingSet 
00579      *  - inherit name and keyframing settings from the typeinfo
00580      */
00581     ks = BKE_keyingset_add(&builtin_keyingsets, ksi->idname, ksi->name, 1, ksi->keyingflag);
00582     
00583     /* link this KeyingSet with its typeinfo */
00584     memcpy(&ks->typeinfo, ksi->idname, sizeof(ks->typeinfo));
00585     
00586     /* Copy description... */
00587     BLI_strncpy(ks->description, ksi->description, sizeof(ks->description));
00588     
00589     /* add type-info to the list */
00590     BLI_addtail(&keyingset_type_infos, ksi);
00591 }
00592 
00593 /* Remove the given KeyingSetInfo from the list of type infos, and also remove the builtin set if appropriate */
00594 void ANIM_keyingset_info_unregister (Main *bmain, KeyingSetInfo *ksi)
00595 {
00596     KeyingSet *ks, *ksn;
00597     
00598     /* find relevant builtin KeyingSets which use this, and remove them */
00599     // TODO: this isn't done now, since unregister is really only used atm when we
00600     // reload the scripts, which kindof defeats the purpose of "builtin"?
00601     for (ks= builtin_keyingsets.first; ks; ks= ksn) {
00602         ksn = ks->next;
00603         
00604         /* remove if matching typeinfo name */
00605         if (strcmp(ks->typeinfo, ksi->idname) == 0) {
00606             Scene *scene;
00607             BKE_keyingset_free(ks);
00608             BLI_remlink(&builtin_keyingsets, ks);
00609 
00610             for (scene= bmain->scene.first; scene; scene= scene->id.next)
00611                 BLI_remlink_safe(&scene->keyingsets, ks);
00612 
00613             MEM_freeN(ks);
00614         }
00615     }
00616     
00617     /* free the type info */
00618     BLI_freelinkN(&keyingset_type_infos, ksi);
00619 }
00620 
00621 /* --------------- */
00622 
00623 void ANIM_keyingset_infos_exit (void)
00624 {
00625     KeyingSetInfo *ksi, *next;
00626     
00627     /* free type infos */
00628     for (ksi=keyingset_type_infos.first; ksi; ksi=next) {
00629         next= ksi->next;
00630         
00631         /* free extra RNA data, and remove from list */
00632         if (ksi->ext.free)
00633             ksi->ext.free(ksi->ext.data);
00634         BLI_freelinkN(&keyingset_type_infos, ksi);
00635     }
00636     
00637     /* free builtin sets */
00638     BKE_keyingsets_free(&builtin_keyingsets);
00639 }
00640 
00641 /* ******************************************* */
00642 /* KEYING SETS API (for UI) */
00643 
00644 /* Getters for Active/Indices ----------------------------- */
00645 
00646 /* Get the active Keying Set for the Scene provided */
00647 KeyingSet *ANIM_scene_get_active_keyingset (Scene *scene)
00648 {
00649     /* if no scene, we've got no hope of finding the Keying Set */
00650     if (scene == NULL)
00651         return NULL;
00652     
00653     /* currently, there are several possibilities here:
00654      *  -   0: no active keying set
00655      *  - > 0: one of the user-defined Keying Sets, but indices start from 0 (hence the -1)
00656      *  - < 0: a builtin keying set
00657      */
00658     if (scene->active_keyingset > 0)
00659         return BLI_findlink(&scene->keyingsets, scene->active_keyingset-1);
00660     else
00661         return BLI_findlink(&builtin_keyingsets, (-scene->active_keyingset)-1);
00662 }
00663 
00664 /* Get the index of the Keying Set provided, for the given Scene */
00665 int ANIM_scene_get_keyingset_index (Scene *scene, KeyingSet *ks)
00666 {
00667     int index;
00668     
00669     /* if no KeyingSet provided, have none */
00670     if (ks == NULL)
00671         return 0;
00672     
00673     /* check if the KeyingSet exists in scene list */
00674     if (scene) {
00675         /* get index and if valid, return 
00676          *  - (absolute) Scene KeyingSets are from (>= 1)
00677          */
00678         index = BLI_findindex(&scene->keyingsets, ks);
00679         if (index != -1)
00680             return (index + 1);
00681     }
00682     
00683     /* still here, so try builtins list too 
00684      *  - builtins are from (<= -1)
00685      *  - none/invalid is (= 0)
00686      */
00687     index = BLI_findindex(&builtin_keyingsets, ks);
00688     if (index != -1)
00689         return -(index + 1);
00690     else
00691         return 0;
00692 }
00693 
00694 /* Get Keying Set to use for Auto-Keyframing some transforms */
00695 KeyingSet *ANIM_get_keyingset_for_autokeying(Scene *scene, const char *tranformKSName)
00696 {
00697     /* get KeyingSet to use 
00698      *  - use the active KeyingSet if defined (and user wants to use it for all autokeying), 
00699      *    or otherwise key transforms only
00700      */
00701     if (IS_AUTOKEY_FLAG(scene, ONLYKEYINGSET) && (scene->active_keyingset))
00702         return ANIM_scene_get_active_keyingset(scene);
00703     else if (IS_AUTOKEY_FLAG(scene, INSERTAVAIL))
00704         return ANIM_builtin_keyingset_get_named(NULL, ANIM_KS_AVAILABLE_ID);
00705     else 
00706         return ANIM_builtin_keyingset_get_named(NULL, tranformKSName);
00707 }
00708 
00709 /* Menu of All Keying Sets ----------------------------- */
00710 
00711 /* Dynamically populate an enum of Keying Sets */
00712 EnumPropertyItem *ANIM_keying_sets_enum_itemf (bContext *C, PointerRNA *UNUSED(ptr), PropertyRNA *UNUSED(prop), int *free)
00713 {
00714     Scene *scene = CTX_data_scene(C);
00715     KeyingSet *ks;
00716     EnumPropertyItem *item= NULL, item_tmp= {0};
00717     int totitem= 0;
00718     int i= 0;
00719 
00720     if (C == NULL) {
00721         return DummyRNA_DEFAULT_items;
00722     }
00723     
00724     /* active Keying Set 
00725      *  - only include entry if it exists
00726      */
00727     if (scene->active_keyingset) {
00728         /* active Keying Set */
00729         item_tmp.identifier= "__ACTIVE__";
00730         item_tmp.name= "Active Keying Set";
00731         item_tmp.value= i;
00732         RNA_enum_item_add(&item, &totitem, &item_tmp);
00733         
00734         /* separator */
00735         RNA_enum_item_add_separator(&item, &totitem);
00736     }
00737     
00738     i++;
00739     
00740     /* user-defined Keying Sets 
00741      *  - these are listed in the order in which they were defined for the active scene
00742      */
00743     if (scene->keyingsets.first) {
00744         for (ks= scene->keyingsets.first; ks; ks= ks->next, i++) {
00745             if (ANIM_keyingset_context_ok_poll(C, ks)) {
00746                 item_tmp.identifier = ks->idname;
00747                 item_tmp.name = ks->name;
00748                 item_tmp.description = ks->description;
00749                 item_tmp.value= i;
00750                 RNA_enum_item_add(&item, &totitem, &item_tmp);
00751             }
00752         }
00753         
00754         /* separator */
00755         RNA_enum_item_add_separator(&item, &totitem);
00756     }
00757     
00758     /* builtin Keying Sets */
00759     i= -1;
00760     for (ks= builtin_keyingsets.first; ks; ks= ks->next, i--) {
00761         /* only show KeyingSet if context is suitable */
00762         if (ANIM_keyingset_context_ok_poll(C, ks)) {
00763             item_tmp.identifier = ks->idname;
00764             item_tmp.name = ks->name;
00765             item_tmp.description = ks->description;
00766             item_tmp.value= i;
00767             RNA_enum_item_add(&item, &totitem, &item_tmp);
00768         }
00769     }
00770 
00771     RNA_enum_item_end(&item, &totitem);
00772     *free= 1;
00773 
00774     return item;
00775 }
00776 
00777 /* ******************************************* */
00778 /* KEYFRAME MODIFICATION */
00779 
00780 /* Polling API ----------------------------------------------- */
00781 
00782 /* Check if KeyingSet can be used in the current context */
00783 short ANIM_keyingset_context_ok_poll (bContext *C, KeyingSet *ks)
00784 {
00785     if ((ks->flag & KEYINGSET_ABSOLUTE) == 0) {
00786         KeyingSetInfo *ksi = ANIM_keyingset_info_find_named(ks->typeinfo);
00787         
00788         /* get the associated 'type info' for this KeyingSet */
00789         if (ksi == NULL)
00790             return 0;
00791         // TODO: check for missing callbacks!
00792         
00793         /* check if it can be used in the current context */
00794         return (ksi->poll(ksi, C));
00795     }
00796     
00797     return 1;
00798 }
00799 
00800 /* Special 'Overrides' Iterator for Relative KeyingSets ------ */
00801 
00802 /* 'Data Sources' for relative Keying Set 'overrides' 
00803  *  - this is basically a wrapper for PointerRNA's in a linked list
00804  *  - do not allow this to be accessed from outside for now
00805  */
00806 typedef struct tRKS_DSource {
00807     struct tRKS_DSource *next, *prev;
00808     PointerRNA ptr;     /* the whole point of this exercise! */
00809 } tRKS_DSource;
00810 
00811 
00812 /* Iterator used for overriding the behavior of iterators defined for 
00813  * relative Keying Sets, with the main usage of this being operators 
00814  * requiring Auto Keyframing. Internal Use Only!
00815  */
00816 static void RKS_ITER_overrides_list (KeyingSetInfo *ksi, bContext *C, KeyingSet *ks, ListBase *dsources)
00817 {
00818     tRKS_DSource *ds;
00819     
00820     for (ds = dsources->first; ds; ds = ds->next) {
00821         /* run generate callback on this data */
00822         ksi->generate(ksi, C, ks, &ds->ptr);
00823     }
00824 }
00825 
00826 /* Add new data source for relative Keying Sets */
00827 void ANIM_relative_keyingset_add_source (ListBase *dsources, ID *id, StructRNA *srna, void *data)
00828 {
00829     tRKS_DSource *ds;
00830     
00831     /* sanity checks 
00832      *  - we must have somewhere to output the data
00833      *  - we must have both srna+data (and with id too optionally), or id by itself only
00834      */
00835     if (dsources == NULL)
00836         return;
00837     if (ELEM(NULL, srna, data) && (id == NULL))
00838         return;
00839     
00840     /* allocate new elem, and add to the list */
00841     ds = MEM_callocN(sizeof(tRKS_DSource), "tRKS_DSource");
00842     BLI_addtail(dsources, ds);
00843     
00844     /* depending on what data we have, create using ID or full pointer call */
00845     if (srna && data)
00846         RNA_pointer_create(id, srna, data, &ds->ptr);
00847     else
00848         RNA_id_pointer_create(id, &ds->ptr);
00849 }
00850 
00851 /* KeyingSet Operations (Insert/Delete Keyframes) ------------ */
00852 
00853 /* Given a KeyingSet and context info, validate Keying Set's paths.
00854  * This is only really necessary with relative/built-in KeyingSets
00855  * where their list of paths is dynamically generated based on the
00856  * current context info.
00857  *
00858  * Returns 0 if succeeded, otherwise an error code: eModifyKey_Returns
00859  */
00860 short ANIM_validate_keyingset (bContext *C, ListBase *dsources, KeyingSet *ks)
00861 {
00862     /* sanity check */
00863     if (ks == NULL)
00864         return 0;
00865     
00866     /* if relative Keying Sets, poll and build up the paths */
00867     if ((ks->flag & KEYINGSET_ABSOLUTE) == 0) {
00868         KeyingSetInfo *ksi = ANIM_keyingset_info_find_named(ks->typeinfo);
00869         
00870         /* clear all existing paths 
00871          * NOTE: BKE_keyingset_free() frees all of the paths for the KeyingSet, but not the set itself
00872          */
00873         BKE_keyingset_free(ks);
00874         
00875         /* get the associated 'type info' for this KeyingSet */
00876         if (ksi == NULL)
00877             return MODIFYKEY_MISSING_TYPEINFO;
00878         // TODO: check for missing callbacks!
00879         
00880         /* check if it can be used in the current context */
00881         if (ksi->poll(ksi, C)) {
00882             /* if a list of data sources are provided, run a special iterator over them,
00883              * otherwise, just continue per normal
00884              */
00885             if (dsources) 
00886                 RKS_ITER_overrides_list(ksi, C, ks, dsources);
00887             else
00888                 ksi->iter(ksi, C, ks);
00889                 
00890             /* if we don't have any paths now, then this still qualifies as invalid context */
00891             if (ks->paths.first == NULL)
00892                 return MODIFYKEY_INVALID_CONTEXT;
00893         }
00894         else {
00895             /* poll callback tells us that KeyingSet is useless in current context */
00896             return MODIFYKEY_INVALID_CONTEXT;
00897         }
00898     }
00899     
00900     /* succeeded; return 0 to tag error free */
00901     return 0;
00902 } 
00903 
00904 /* Given a KeyingSet and context info (if required), modify keyframes for the channels specified
00905  * by the KeyingSet. This takes into account many of the different combinations of using KeyingSets.
00906  * Returns the number of channels that keyframes were added to
00907  */
00908 int ANIM_apply_keyingset (bContext *C, ListBase *dsources, bAction *act, KeyingSet *ks, short mode, float cfra)
00909 {
00910     Scene *scene= CTX_data_scene(C);
00911     ReportList *reports = CTX_wm_reports(C);
00912     KS_Path *ksp;
00913     int kflag=0, success= 0;
00914     char *groupname= NULL;
00915     
00916     /* sanity checks */
00917     if (ks == NULL)
00918         return 0;
00919     
00920     /* get flags to use */
00921     if (mode == MODIFYKEY_MODE_INSERT) {
00922         /* use KeyingSet's flags as base */
00923         kflag= ks->keyingflag;
00924         
00925         /* suppliment with info from the context */
00926         kflag |= ANIM_get_keyframing_flags(scene, 1);
00927     }
00928     else if (mode == MODIFYKEY_MODE_DELETE)
00929         kflag= 0;
00930     
00931     /* if relative Keying Sets, poll and build up the paths */
00932     success = ANIM_validate_keyingset(C, dsources, ks);
00933     
00934     if (success != 0) {
00935         /* return error code if failed */
00936         return success;
00937     }
00938     
00939     /* apply the paths as specified in the KeyingSet now */
00940     for (ksp= ks->paths.first; ksp; ksp= ksp->next) { 
00941         int arraylen, i;
00942         short kflag2;
00943         
00944         /* skip path if no ID pointer is specified */
00945         if (ksp->id == NULL) {
00946             BKE_reportf(reports, RPT_WARNING,
00947                 "Skipping path in Keying Set, as it has no ID (KS = '%s', Path = '%s'[%d])",
00948                 ks->name, ksp->rna_path, ksp->array_index);
00949             continue;
00950         }
00951         
00952         /* since keying settings can be defined on the paths too, extend the path before using it */
00953         kflag2 = (kflag | ksp->keyingflag);
00954         
00955         /* get pointer to name of group to add channels to */
00956         if (ksp->groupmode == KSP_GROUP_NONE)
00957             groupname= NULL;
00958         else if (ksp->groupmode == KSP_GROUP_KSNAME)
00959             groupname= ks->name;
00960         else
00961             groupname= ksp->group;
00962         
00963         /* init arraylen and i - arraylen should be greater than i so that
00964          * normal non-array entries get keyframed correctly
00965          */
00966         i= ksp->array_index;
00967         arraylen= i;
00968         
00969         /* get length of array if whole array option is enabled */
00970         if (ksp->flag & KSP_FLAG_WHOLE_ARRAY) {
00971             PointerRNA id_ptr, ptr;
00972             PropertyRNA *prop;
00973             
00974             RNA_id_pointer_create(ksp->id, &id_ptr);
00975             if (RNA_path_resolve(&id_ptr, ksp->rna_path, &ptr, &prop) && prop)
00976                 arraylen= RNA_property_array_length(&ptr, prop);
00977         }
00978         
00979         /* we should do at least one step */
00980         if (arraylen == i)
00981             arraylen++;
00982         
00983         /* for each possible index, perform operation 
00984          *  - assume that arraylen is greater than index
00985          */
00986         for (; i < arraylen; i++) {
00987             /* action to take depends on mode */
00988             if (mode == MODIFYKEY_MODE_INSERT)
00989                 success += insert_keyframe(reports, ksp->id, act, groupname, ksp->rna_path, i, cfra, kflag2);
00990             else if (mode == MODIFYKEY_MODE_DELETE)
00991                 success += delete_keyframe(reports, ksp->id, act, groupname, ksp->rna_path, i, cfra, kflag2);
00992         }
00993         
00994         /* set recalc-flags */
00995         switch (GS(ksp->id->name)) {
00996             case ID_OB: /* Object (or Object-Related) Keyframes */
00997             {
00998                 Object *ob= (Object *)ksp->id;
00999                 
01000                 ob->recalc |= OB_RECALC_OB|OB_RECALC_DATA|OB_RECALC_TIME; // XXX: only object transforms only?
01001             }
01002                 break;
01003         }
01004         
01005         /* send notifiers for updates (this doesn't require context to work!) */
01006         WM_main_add_notifier(NC_ANIMATION|ND_KEYFRAME|NA_EDITED, NULL);
01007     }
01008     
01009     /* return the number of channels successfully affected */
01010     return success;
01011 }
